item.title: Remembering the Sans Souci Hotel and Casino: A Vintage Vegas Gem Lost to Time
item.description:
From Auto Court to Strip Icon: The Early Years

Before the mega-resorts and dazzling lights, the Las Vegas Strip was a much different place. Located at 3320 Las Vegas Boulevard South, across from the legendary Sands Hotel, the Sans Souci Hotel and Casino was a vital part of that evolving landscape. Its story began in the 1930s as the Mountain View Auto Court, catering to weary travelers on U.S. Highway 91 – the very road that would become the Strip. This modest auto court provided a crucial stopping point for those journeying across the desert. The pivotal change came in 1939 with a new name: the Sans Souci, French for “without a care.” This instantly evoked a sense of relaxed luxury and signaled an ambition for something more than a simple motor lodge.
